ImaamʿAlī ibn al-Jaʿd ibn ʿUbayd, the Imam, Hadith Master, Authority in Transmission, and the Musnid of Baghdad, Abū al-Ḥasan al-Baghdādī.

His Encounter with al-Maʾmūn

ʿAbd al-Razzāq ibn Sulaymān ibn ʿAlī ibn al-Jaʿd narrated:

“I heard my father say: Al-Maʾmūn once summoned jewel merchants and engaged them in a discussion about their goods. After a while, he left to attend to some business and then returned. When he entered, everyone in the gathering stood up for him—except for ʿAlī ibn al-Jaʿd.”

Al-Maʾmūn looked at him with displeasure, then signalled for him to meet him in private.

He asked: “O Shaykh, what prevented you from standing?”

ʿAlī ibn al-Jaʿd replied:

“O Commander of the believers, I refrained from standing out of reverence for a hadith that we narrate from the Prophet ﷺ.”

Al-Maʾmūn asked: “And what is that hadith?”

He responded:

*”I heard Mubārak ibn Faḍālah say, that he heard al-Ḥasan say:

The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

‘Whoever loves that men should stand for him out of honour, let him take his seat in the Fire.’“1

Hearing this, al-Maʾmūn fell silent in contemplation. Then he raised his head and declared:

“No purchases should be made except from this man!”

That day, they bought from him thirty thousand dinars’ worth of goods!.

(Siyar A’laamin Nubalaa: 10/459)

  1. Collected by Abu Daawood (5229) At Tirmidhi in his Sunan (2755) and declared Saheeh upon the conditions of Bukhaari and Muslim by Shaikh Albaani in Silsilatul Ahaadeeth As Saheehah (357) ↩︎
